channel.title: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?
channel.description: Only 4 hours till the main event. I got Mayweather winning this one. I would like to see Manny beat him but Floyd I feel has aged much better than Manny and he is too defensively intelligent.

item.title: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

Vain_:

lol @ all the people who paid $100 to watch it tho

Had like 60 people over to watch it on a 90’. Still not worth the splitting cost, haha.

Read full topic
item.source: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?

item.title: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

casey.:

Boring fight. Pacquia out of his prime and Mayweather fighting conservatively. They could have reinvented boxing, but anyone watching who was unfamiliar will be turned away. UFC definitely going to take the audience .

I don’t particularly like boxing in general, only watching Mayweather gets me intrigued. My favourite sport is MMA and I agree. Once Mayweather retires boxing is well at truly dead. Just wait for the all mighty Conor McGregor to take the UFC to a whole other level.

Inb4UFC189

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

Davidi2:

i heard floyd was supposed to beat up pac and then hug his wife, but he got the two mixed up

That was golden.

As much as I wanted Pac to win, I figured douchebag Floyd would take it home. Regardless, it was a pretty boring fight and I feel Pac probably deserved more rounds than the judges gave to him. Amazing athletes nonetheless.

item.source: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?

item.title: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Again we witnessed why Floyd is probably one of the smartest boxers to ever walk the earth. Tonight’s fight proved Pacquiao is a better fighter, but Floyd is a better boxer - atleast that’s how I broke it down. Floyd shut down arguably the most offensive fighter in the world and countered him perfectly. I kinda knew Floyd would implement a sort of rope-a-dopeish method, he always does. I was just curious as to how he’d do it against an awkward southpaw like Pacquiao.

Damn I actually just watched a full replay of the fight. After knowing what the score was post fight I paid attention to Floyd and counted his countering combos. Floyd dominated that fight. Hats off, he was the better fighter. I still like Manny and think he’s great for boxing.

Read full topic

item.title: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Welliton you must realize that Bowser doesn’t care about entertainment or the one’s he considers lesser beings, there is no point in trying to argue with him. You won’t win. He won’t win. This page will just get 8 pages long until someone rage quits (probably you, he’s done this before) and then we get on with our lives and this 20-active-member community.

Read full topic
item.source: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?

item.title: Mayweather v Pacquiao - Who ya got?
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:9, topic:551324”][quote author=Welliton_inc link=topic=670239.msg4481853#msg4481853 date=1430611575]

No an interesting match. I would rather see David Cameron and Nigel Farage in a boxing match, that would be something I would pay to see. No two rich guys earning shit-tons (imperial) punching eachother.

Maybe to you, but for millions of people around the world this is a must-see fight. If you had nothing to really contribute to the thread why did you comment?
[/quote]
I pointing out that this match is stupid. It’s just rich overpaid guys beating up each-other for a couple of minutes. And I completely fail to see how the result here will affect you. If we’re seeing sport as nationalism and the athlete represent the country, we might see a reason for Americans to root for Mayweather. But he is not a good representative for your country. He beat up his daughter’s mother due to some dispute. He earns shitlot of money while fighting very few matches. He is not a good American.[/quote]
Mayweather doesn’t represent my country as I am from Scotland. Obviously because you don’t have any sort of passion for combat sports, you won’t understand the magnitude of this fight, or the skill level you will witness between these two elite boxing champions. This is a fight that has been in the making for literally years. This is the fight to truly see if Mayweather’s career was a success. The reason why they are earning the shit ton that they are is because of the people paying to watch. And if we are to talk about an athlete representing your country, Manny is a perfect example. The Philippines literally love him. He is a humble family-man who lived a rough life but overcame that, there was even talks about him becoming the president of the Philippines.

Read full topic
